Posts.Content: Hi All Hope everyone is getting that Friday feeling. I’m feeling really confused.... I’ve been diagnosed with a grade 1 tubular cancer in my left breast measuring 2.5 cms. Further tests, mri and biopsies have shown up two separate large areas of calcs graded B3. I’ve had a repeat biopsy on one area confirming B3 and on Monday get the results for the repeat biopsy on the other area of calcs. A decision will then be made as to which route I take a) lumpectomy and radiotherapy or b) mastectomy. My fear is this...I have the lumpectomy/radiotherapy but the calcs are still there with their ‘unknown malignant potential’ I realise I’d be monitored but I’m scared that I won’t be able to just ‘get on’ with life. The other option is the mastectomy but then am I being overly dramatic??? Has anyone had a similar situation?? Sorry it’s such a long message...feeling very

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for sharing your journey so far....it really helps to hear others experiences. I’ve got my appointment at 9.30 tomorrow and the last of the biopsy results. I don’t think I’ll have a definite idea which way I want to go until then. Best of luck with your recovery-it sounds as if you’re doing brilliantly xxxx
